Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL LOG IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the well log.
Column Comment.2: WELL LOG SOURCE: the source of the well log that has been referenced.
Column Comment.3: PARAMETER SEQUENCE NUMBER: a number that is used to order the parametersin the sequence they are to be reported in when output.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: ARRAY INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether a parameter array is present forthis parameter.
Column Comment.6: DESCRIPTION: short narrative description of the parameter reported for the log file.
Column Comment.7: WELL LOG DICTIONARY: The dictionary contains a set of curve names, propertynames and parameters that are used by a well logging contracter during a specifiedperiod of time. At any given time, a contractor may have one or more dictionaries inuse.
Column Comment.8: PARAMETER IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the well log parameter.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.11: LOG PARAMETER OUTPUT: The format that a parameter is to be output as whenreporting or recreating a digital log file.
Column Comment.12: PARAMETER VALUE: the value of the parameter that has been reported for this welllog.
Column Comment.13: PARAMETER VALUE: The numeric value of the parameter. As this column is in avertical table, the format may range from very large to very small numbers. Noprecision is defined.
Column Comment.16: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.17: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.18: DESCRIPTION: short narrative description of the parameter reported for the log file.Used in the case where information reported from the logging company is to becaptured.
Column Comment.19: REPORTED MNEMONIC: the mnemonic or code given to the parameter in theoriginal data, as reported. Not validated. The validated value is derived fromPARAMETER ID.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
